body.p: The Congregation Beth Elohim of Charleston.
No 6 full price

The attention of the Jewish Public being directed to the
movement of this congregation, we beg leave to lay before them
a statistical and comprehensive sketch of the part and parsing
events which have agitated and are now agitating this body.

At the period when the Rev Y Posnanski was elected for a probationary term of two years Hazan of the
K. K. B. E. it was one of the most Orthodox, Religious, & Charatable
in the United States.—after the expiration of one year. The Congregation
in consideration of his ardent zeal in the cause of our holy Religion
his piety and conformation to all the laws both Mosaic and
Rabbinical, Elected him for life.

As soon as this event took place a course diametrically
opposite was immediately pursued by Mr Poznanski, which
was the cause of the disastrous outbreak in 1841, when upwards
of Forty of the oldest most consciensious and most strictly conservative members were
scrupulously compelled to resign withdraw, (among whom were
the founders of the congregation) and to leave in the power of
its rulers not only that Sacred Edifice which was identified with
many Holy associations, but but were denied any participation in the management of the Kyrankyamits
Fund to which they had largely contributed until it had
accumulated to the Sum of $25.000. the Interest of which
was appropriated to support the very individual who by his
arbitrary and anti Jewish Conduct cause another dispersion
in Israel, and depriving the aged supporters of the Congregation
their Venerable matrons and their children, not only of a place
of worship but also of the priveledges of Sepulture, for imme-
-diately upon their withdrawal, the constitution of the KKBE.
was amended as follows “Any Subscriber Yehid, or member
of this Congregation, male or Female who shall habitually
attend Divine service at any other place of worship within
the city than that of the KKB.E. or subscribe there to as
members or Yeshidim shall be charged annually One Hundred
Dollars” We do not deem any comment necessary.

The Congregation remained in a lethargic state until
its second Revolution in 1843, which involved it in an

expensive and tedious have Suit, and ended in the withdrawal
of about 25 members, who were opposed to the abrogation
of the 2nd Day of the Hollidays and other innovations suggested
by Mr Posnanski. This Event caused a great deal of unhappiness
and dissensions among families who had hitherto lived in
peace and Friendship, untill the advent of Mr Posnanski
and the promulgation of his new doctrines. These
Twenty Five joined with those who had withdrawn in 1841.
The K K B.E. Is now threatened with a third, and probably,
a final dissolution, when this event takes place—and
of its near approach, indications never were more preferable—
it will, no doubt, cause the overthrow forever of the un-
-hallowed and vain panoply of power with which its present
Rulers are invested.

It numbers at this time about Forty Members and
is divided into two parties whom we shall call, for the
sake of distinction, Radical and Conservative. Their
present minister the Rev Julius Eckman, was elected
about Eleven months ago (Mr Poznanski having resigned),
on a probationary term of two years. This Gentleman
is a regularly ordained רב מורה בישראל (and empowered) by virtue of
a Diploma honorably conferred on him, under the seals
of the Rabbinates of Berlin and Prenzlaw (which are
two of the greatest acknowledged authorities of Europe) and was duly prepared
by an examination at the Royal Fredrick Willhelm
College at Berlin, and by his having been a Civis Universitatis
Berolinensis rite inscriptus, for the space of five years. He was
elected, contrary to his expectations as he had expressed
himself to all those who called on him previous to that
time as being entirely opposed to the principles of avowed by their
late Hazan, and in his Inaugural address he express-
edly told them the congregation that he appeared before them simply
as a teacher in Israel and objected to being considered
their spiritual Head.
The cause of the division unto two parties of such

opposite extremes originated as follows. The Revd Dr
Eckman from repealed conversations from on his first arrival
with Mr Posnanski and from personal observations afterwards,
found that all positive religion had fallen into Decay was rejected
no religious instruction was communicated in the synagogue
(as Mr Posnanski did not lecture) prophecy was denied, hence
the denial of all that is Dogmatical Doctrinal and National. The
non observance of the Law not only passively connived at,
but he exposed some Laws that might offend our
modern delicacy, to the view of his adherents the more
effectually to prove there was no nescessity for observing them
his request to Dr. E. to preach against the Rabbies and
all observances whither Biblical or Rabbinical and his acknowledgment to him
that it was of no consequence where the bible came from
convinced Dr Eckman of Mr Posnanskis rank daring Infidelity,
as Mr Newman calls it. Dr Eckman kept silent
untill Yom Kipur when Mr Posnanski was called to
take part in the sacred functions of that day. This Dr
Eckman, as an honest man, could not consent to
and and privately remonstrated with Mr Posnanski on the great
crime of Profanation. Mr Poznanski replied, that
he not only did not believe the Yom Kipur these prayers,
but he detested them, whereupon Dr Eckman
denounced him to the Parnass. Not only as an Infidel
but inimically disposed to the very Institution of
Judaism, and positively refused to take any part
in the service of that day. The Personal friends
of Mr Posnanski immediately arrayed themselves in
open hostilities against Dr Eckman and have waged them untill the present
time. The great Injustice of this course persecution being so
evident to the public, and Dr. Eckmans straight
German course in the cause of Religion and Truth
has drawn to his Standard of True Faith a large
number of the most respectable and intelligent members of the congregation*
The Radical or Posnanski party numbers exactly Eighteen
*among whom we mention Mr Joshua Lazarus the Prest of the congregation and Mr M C Mordecai?,
both so honorably named in your last number.

the Conservative party Fifteen members and four Congregators
the remaining 8 or 9 members Eight or nine, are
indisposed to take any part in Congregational affairs.
altho we believe they convinced of the fallacious
ideas they have recently entertained on Religious subjects.

The public denunciation of the creed By Dr Eckman at the Tabernacle
Lecture Room some weeks ago; as being anti Jewish, and as
having been surreptitiously introduced in the Synagogue,
gave publicity to the following facts viz.

The Building Committee received instructions from the
congregation to have “Our Creed translated and placed
in the synagogue; and recommended the services assistance of their
Hazan the Rev. G Posnanski for that purpose, the committee
accordingly informed that Gentn of the wishes of the
congregation, to which he assented, and they subsequently this prepared
received from him creed was placed in the synagogue as Our „the Maimonidian” creed
that which is now placed in the synagogue It contains
like that of Maimonides thirteen articles of I and
purports to be “Elements of Jewish Faith.”

This committee, with the exception of Mr Posnanski, with fearless magninimity, have
recently expressed, that they have no pretentions to
Biblical or Rabbinical Lore, that they never supposed
that it this creed aimed a blow at the very vitals of Judaism,
they received this creed it in full faith of its really
being, that which the congregation requested them to
procure viz a translation of “our the Maimonidian
Creed and if it were any thing else, it was not
the acknowledged creed of the congregation;
a Public meeting of the Sunday School attached
to the K K B.E. under the sole control of the Ladies
of the Congregation, was convened soon after this and
the creed which had hitherto been taught, was rejected
and forever expelled from school by a vote of 25 to 3.
It would not be out of place here to answer “C” a
the objections which of “C” in the last “Occident” to
the views

Mr Newman takes (on his anima criticism of this creed) of the substitution of the Divine
Law handed by moses to our Fathers” for the Universal
believe (and correct translation of Maimonides). “that the
Law was given delivered unto Moses by God,” I
The only article of Faith necessary for any believer
is that of תורה מן השמים if this is admitted then the
other two propose by “Albo,” and the Twelve according to
Maimonides, follow of themselves, as there whole
Bible is there acknowledged to be given by God
to and all the contents binding, but this very
article is distorted and rendered inane by
the alteration introduced in article 8th where
instead of the Universal belief that the Law was
delivered to Moses by God, it is in Mr Posnanskis
creed only considered as a divine Law delivered
by Moses unto our Fathers—now a “divine
Law delivered by Moses may mean no more
than and stand no higher than, a “Divine Poem
By Milton, a Divine Hymn, by Dr Watts
“Divine Service by an incompetent Lay man
or a Divine Comedy by “Dante,” the word
“Divine” is of less import than “Sacred”, and
“divine and sacred less than “Holy”. The draft
of the Translator may easily be percured by
comparing Article 9th which immediately follows
when instead of the Positive and emphatic assertion
that of Maimonides viz we believe with a firm/perfect faith, that
this Law will never be changed or altered, and
that there will be no other Law Given by the
Creator Blessed be his name, he simply states
that we believe the divine Law will never be
altered or changed”, he has expunged or forgot
to translate, what we so very much want to hear
viz that the Creator blessed be his name, never will
give any other Law.
“C” also states that Mr.

Poznanski “never advocated doctrines that conflicted with the
cardinal principles of our religion.” It is not difficult
to infer what a man's moral and religious principles
are when his own words and actions sufficiently
indicate them.

Firstly—in his discussion with Dr Raphall, when asked
if he believed in the Bible in the Law & the Prophets
he in the presence of both Organizations replied after a long hesitation Y-e-s with qualifications some

We also understand “C” is the author of the Petition

and in a short time afterwards subverting our faith
by introducing into the synagogue, one of his own
manufacture which his replete with Infidelity &
Irreligion”

The Posnanski parties finding themselves reduced
in the last Ten Years from over One Hundred voting members
to only Eighteen, and destruction approaching from exposure of
their leader by Dr Eckman determined as a last
resort they being in the majority on the Board of
Trustees, to transmit a petition to the Board with
the request that Dr Eckman should resign as they did not think men suited their needs?. This
Petition, Signed by the Eighteen members, was
accordingly sent in, and a resolution passed
by a note of 4 to 3 that Dr Eckman should comply
with the weeks of the petitions, a contra petition
was also sent to the Board signed by Fifteen members
